query: Q28. Which code is a valid JSON equivalent of the key/value pair shown that also preserves the data type? `constant: 6.022E23`
options:
`"constant": "6.022E23"`
 `"constant": "6\.022\E23"`
 `constant: 6.022E23`
 `constant: "6.022E23"`

Explanation: Scientific Notation is a valid JSON number. You can use `e` or `E`. [(Reference)](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html)
